Key Match Events: Netherlands won by 5 wickets (with 3 balls remaining)
Jan Frylinck is the Player of the Match
Post-Match Reflections: Jan Frylinck - 'We were about 15-20 runs short'
Scott Edwards, the winning captain: 'We did well in terms of front-loading the runs'
Gerhard Erasmus, the Namibia captain: 'Never nice to be on the losing side... With the bat it seemed difficult for both sides'
Bas de Leede is the Player of the Match: 'I took a bit of experience from two days ago. Some of the guys will be bitter that I am scooping up wickets at the end!'
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is some start to the WC every game throwing up surprises and keeping us on the edge of the seats. Toss not giving undue advantage to one of the sides is the prime reason and of course the big boundaries help as well.
Others: The match swung like a pendulum until the dying moments. Netherlands needlessly made life difficult for themselves, as Namibia sneaked into the contest.
Sitting pretty at 92 for 1 in the 14th over, there was no way this game would have gone so deep; and in the end, it was a matter of a few runs or a few balls here and there.
D Shah: 'This means SL have to win their last 2 matches convincingly keeping one eye on the NRR as there are chances both SL and Namibia are stuck on 4 points.',

Ganesh: 'This is the start to the WC every game throwing up surprises and keeping us on the edge of the seats. Toss not giving undue advantage to one of the sides is the prime reason and of course the big boundaries help as well.'
